definition: Moved to a new location (but not necessarily transferred to a new owner)
Given to another - usually a museum
Sold but not known whether a direct sale or at auction
Direct sale (i.e. not sent to auction)
An event which encompasses both sending to auction and sale at auction
Sent by the seller to an auction house
Sold by an auction house to a buyer
Category of lost and stolen events
Category of damage and destruction events
Stored by the recipient at another site
Stored by the recipient at their site
Object is used, rather than being stored or displayed
Used as a storage facility, e.g. a rail van used as a store
Used as part of the facilities (e.g. as a leaflet rack)
Kept by closed museum as decoration
Object has been changed in some way, such as being cut up
Rescued, e.g. from a fire or to prevent disposal
Object rescued, e.g. a sunken boat lifted from the water
Object has been recorded, e.g. for details of condition and construction
Ownership was transferred by default via a liquidation process
